Job__01.1: There was a man in the land of <u>Hus</u>, whose name was Job, and that man was <u>simple</u> and upright, and fearing God, and avoiding evil.
Job__01.2: And there were born to him seven sons and three daughters.
Job__01.3: And his possession was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she asses, and a family exceeding great: and this man was great among all the people of the east.
Job__01.4: And his sons went, <u>and made a feast by houses</u> every one in his day. And sending they called their three sisters to eat and drink with them.
Job__01.5: And when the days of their feasting were gone about, Job sent to them, and sanctified them: and rising up early offered holocausts for every one of them. For he said: Lest perhaps my sons have sinned, and have <u>blessed</u> God in their hearts. So did Job all days.
Job__01.6: Now on a certain day when <u>the sons of God</u> came to stand before the Lord, Satan also was present among them.
Job__01.7: And the Lord said to him: Whence comest thou? And he answered and said: I have gone round about the earth, and walked through it.
Job__01.8: And the Lord said to him: Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a simple and upright man, and fearing God, and avoiding evil?
Job__01.9: And Satan answering, said: Doth Job fear God in vain?
Job__01.10: Hast not thou made a fence for him, and his house, and all his substance round about, blessed the works of his hands, and his possession hath increased on the earth?
Job__01.11: But stretch forth thy hand a little, and touch all that he hath, and see if he blesseth thee not to thy face.
Job__01.12: Then the Lord said to Satan: Behold, all that he hath is in thy hand: only put not forth thy hand upon his person. And Satan went forth from the presence of the Lord.
Job__01.13: Now upon a certain day when his sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother,
Job__01.14: There came a messenger to Job, and said: The oxen were ploughing, and the asses feeding beside them,
Job__01.15: And the Sabeans rushed in, and took all away, and slew the servants with the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
Job__01.16: And while he was yet speaking, another came, and said: The fire of God fell from heaven, and striking the sheep and the servants, hath consumed them, and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
Job__01.17: And while he also was yet speaking, there came another, and said: The Chaldeans made three troops, and have fallen upon the camels, and taken them, moreover they have slain the servants with the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
Job__01.18: He was yet speaking, and behold another came in, and said: Thy sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their elder brother:
Job__01.19: A violent wind came on a sudden from the side of the desert, and shook the four corners of the house, and it fell upon thy children and they are dead, and I alone have escaped to tell thee.
Job__01.20: Then Job rose up, and rent his garments, and having shaven his head fell down upon the ground and worshipped,
Job__01.21: And said: Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away: as it hath pleased the Lord so is it done: blessed be the name of the Lord.
Job__01.22: In all these things Job sinned not by his lips, nor spoke he any foolish thing against God.
